Class Dragster

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dragster

  • public class Dragster
extends java.lang.Object
    Dragster is a class to represent a dragster that races at a drag strip. Create Dragster objects and "race" them to determine their elapsed time for a 1/4 mile race.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int burnTime
      Private instance variable for the number of seconds to "burn out" the tires.
      private double reactionTime
      Private instance variable for the time it takes the driver to react to the "go" signal.
      private int torque
      Private instance variable for the amount of torque (ft-lbs) generated by the engine.
      private double TORQUE2TIME
      Private constant to convert torque values to equivalent time.
      private double traction
      Private instance variable for the amount of traction the tires have.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dragster(double reactionTime, int torque, double traction, int burn)
      Constructor for a Dragster.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void burnout()
      Function to "burn out" the dragster tires just prior to racing.
      private double conditionTires(double time)
      Conditioning function to prepare tires for race 2.5 * ( e^ -( (time * time - (10 * time) + 25) / 50 ) ) / sqrt( 2 * PI )
      double race()
      Perform the race.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the following String representation of this Dragster object with the following format: Reaction Time: w Torque: x Traction: y Burn Time: z Where w, x, y, and z are the reactionTime, torque, traction and burnTime

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • reactionTime

        private double reactionTime
        Private instance variable for the time it takes the driver to react to the "go" signal. Typical time is around 0.5 second.

      • torque

        private int torque
        Private instance variable for the amount of torque (ft-lbs) generated by the engine. Typical values are around 1000.

      • TORQUE2TIME

        private final double TORQUE2TIME
        Private constant to convert torque values to equivalent time. Value = 5000
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • traction

        private double traction
        Private instance variable for the amount of traction the tires have. Typical values for traction are between 0.5 and 1.0. Tires are "conditioned" prior to racing by "burning out" (squealing the tires in place) to remove a layer of oxidized rubber and to preheat the tire. Typical burnout times are a few seconds (under 10 seconds).

      • burnTime

        private int burnTime
        Private instance variable for the number of seconds to "burn out" the tires. Typically under 10 seconds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dragster

        public Dragster(double reactionTime,
                int torque,
                double traction,
                int burn)
        Constructor for a Dragster.
        Parameters:
        reactionTime - time to react to start signal
        torque - power generated by the engine
        traction - how good the traction is
        burn - how many seconds to "burn out" the tires

    • Method Detail

      • conditionTires

        private double conditionTires(double time)
        Conditioning function to prepare tires for race 2.5 * ( e^ -( (time * time - (10 * time) + 25) / 50 ) ) / sqrt( 2 * PI )
        Parameters:
        time - The number of seconds to burnout the tires
        Returns:
        The effectiveness of that time (a number between 0 and 1)

      • burnout

        public void burnout()
        Function to "burn out" the dragster tires just prior to racing. Sets the traction as a result of "burning out" the tires. traction = traction * burnFactor Where burnFactor is the value returned from conditionTires().

      • race

        public double race()
        Perform the race. Calculates a race time. The race time will be determined by the following: reactionTime + ( 1 / ( (torque / TORQUE2TIME) * effectiveTraction ) )
        Returns:
        The time for the dragster to travel 1/4 mile

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the following String representation of this Dragster object with the following format: Reaction Time: w Torque: x Traction: y Burn Time: z Where w, x, y, and z are the reactionTime, torque, traction and burnTime
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this dragster with reaction time, torque, traction and burnout time
